intro: Cyrtandra mucronata, commonly known as the Hawaiian tree nettle, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, often reddish stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale blue flowers that are typically borne on short pedicels. Cyrtandra mucronata is an evergreen shrub or small tree, often found in moist, shaded habitats within Hawaiian rainforests. It plays a significant role in the ecological diversity of its native environment.
